title: Issue with regex with Mac M1 chip
body:
### Environment information
          
* eth-brownie Version: 1.17.0
* ganache Version: 2.5.4
* vyper version: 0.3.0
* Python Version: 3.9.5
* OS: Mac os  Big Sur 11.4 Apple M1 Chip

### What was wrong?
This works fine in  eth-brownie 1.16.4

But in eth-brownie 1.17.0:

I am running this in pycharm venv:
(venv) gudkovm@MBP blockchain % brownie

Error:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/bin/brownie", line 5, in <module>
    from brownie._cli.__main__ import main
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/brownie/__init__.py", line 6, in <module>
    from brownie.project import compile_source, run
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/brownie/project/__init__.py", line 3, in <module>
    from .main import (  # NOQA 401
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/brownie/project/main.py", line 44, in <module>
    from brownie.network import web3
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/brownie/network/__init__.py", line 4, in <module>
    from .account import Accounts
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/brownie/network/account.py", line 37, in <module>
    from .rpc import Rpc
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/brownie/network/rpc/__init__.py", line 16, in <module>
    from brownie.network.state import Chain
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/brownie/network/state.py", line 23, in <module>
    from .transaction import TransactionReceipt
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/brownie/network/transaction.py", line 15, in <module>
    import black
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/black/__init__.py", line 13, in <module>
    import regex as re
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/regex/__init__.py", line 1, in <module>
    from .regex import *
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/regex/regex.py", line 419, in <module>
    import regex._regex_core as _regex_core
  File "/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/regex/_regex_core.py", line 21, in <module>
    import regex._regex as _regex
ImportError: dlopen(/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/regex/_regex.cpython-39-darwin.so, 2): no suitable image found.  Did find:
        /Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/regex/_regex.cpython-39-darwin.so: code signature in (/Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/regex/_regex.cpython-39-darwin.so) not valid for use in process using Library Validation: Trying to load an unsigned library
Hi @moratb , I have same your issue on M1 with version 1.17. How to solve it? Thanks

Just solved it by run: 
xcrun codesign --sign - "[YOUR_PATH_TO_DYLIB_HERE]"

in moratb case path is: /Users/gudkovm/PycharmProjects/blockchain/venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/regex/_regex.cpython-39-darwin.so
